page.title: 04Life in a Middle School
page.content: At {Bartley Middle School}a wide curriculum is followed. The basic subjects; Mathematics, English and Religious Studies, are taught using Work Cards in preference to text books. Project work also takes place, covering History, Geographry and Nature. Use is also made of television programmes to assist in this. Music is taught by a specialist teacher throughout the school. School rules are kept to a minimum and are only made to aid the safety of the pupils, eg. No running in the corridors. Toys are banned to prevent loss of valubles. The School does not have a set uniform. The chilren may wear any combination of white, red, black, yellow and grey. The one important occasion in the school year is Sports Day
